content.body: For your reading pleasure: http://glazkov.com/2011/01/14/what-the-heck-is-shadow-dom/
http://glazkov.com/2011/01/14/what-the-heck-is-shadow-dom/ is a great writeup
http://www.w3.org/html/wg/wiki/ChangeProposals/NoLayoutTable # i don't really care either way about this issue, but these points are, um, stretching the truth a bit
Hehe, "that magnetic meme duo".
TabAtkins: yeah, mother effing magic
gsnedders: you got to ween yourself off of the Nabokov, man
no good can come of it
MikeSmith: Friend at uni here is doing presentation on Pale Fire next week. So there's an excuse for it :P
you should go heckle your friend during the presentation
Holy crap: http://www.steampunkworkshop.com/victorian-all-one-pc
I expected a difference engine. I'm not impressed.
Good.  Less competition when I break into his house and steal it.
beowulf: what points are stretching the truth?

gsnedders: "A powerful black-metal alliance announced to fill Europe with a smell of blood and sulphur. The Swedish occultists of WATAIN get prepared for an unholy impact in collaboration with their suicidal brothers of SHINING and AOSOTH."

"Through this Death Holy Death Tour, these masters of inverted doctrines pull down your good sense in life with some skull-crushing black metallic hymns which will cut into your flesh! With their current release titled “Lawless Darkness”, black metal militia WATAIN have demonstrated that the might of ravenblack spiritual music can abduct the listener into a kingdom of eternal darkness." Get afraid of the darkest assault of the
TabAtkins: ok i filled in what we talked about (and some other stuff) http://www.w3.org/html/wg/wiki/ChangeProposals/NoLayoutTable
Philip`, see pm
hmm. jd seems to be unhappy about Mozilla "expanding scope" to video: http://blogs.adobe.com/jd/2011/01/video-debate-cutting-to-the-chase.html
Hixie: avoiding undermining a decade of "stay the course" advocacy didn't deter you from not calling text/html XHTML and from obsoleting longdesc.
Hixie: why is it now an argument for staying the course with layout table propaganda?
Hixie: the UI of valitor.nu uses tables for aligning UI widgets but undoes the table display on narrow view ports using media queries, so the media query rationale isn't strong, either
*validator.nu
all in all, I think the ISSUE 130 counter-CP is rather weak in its argumentation
dglazkov?
hmm
"pseudo attribute" link is broken
krijnh, hahaha, meer twittergedichten graag
fyi, for everyone with a html5.org account, it's prolly a good idea to change passwords and check files
There, the irc-logs for 2010 are closed, no more important line flagging

anyone know if in safari there's a keyboard shortcut for clicking a link that I currently have some text selected in? IIRC I could do that in Camino a few years ago, using enter or something: helpful when doing a search within the page

TabAtkins: sorry to be so slow at it, but I'm actually plugging away at the "perceptual attributes" gradient editor thing mentioned a month ago -- one of those bit-by-bit sort of projects. I have CIECAM02 implemented in JS in forward/reverse directions, and have started the code for graphing the values of J (lightness) C (chroma) h (hue) along a gradient
also, people on www-style don't seem to understand premultiplied alpha very well
do you know a common equivalent of XUL?
Hmm, I get an email about rel=up and Thunderbird thinks it's spam. I wonder why that is
annevk: thanks for pointing out the URL type
tyope
arg
typo
heh, good to know you read the logs
I usually don't, but I started seeing them in referrals
Yes! Finally my name is in his referrals \o/
whoa. you're a real person?
Of course
He is a construct of the cabal
The backbone actually! ;)
He's represents the proletariat that carries the rest of us on their backs
I always assumed you're some Hixie's imaginary moniker, like, well, hixie or damowmow
Blasphemy, Hixie is his True Name
oh. Then apparently I know nothing about this world.
I made a user script to create next/prev buttons, krijnh
So now I won't bug you anymore
You bugged me?
Hm
Share!
omg https://developer.mozilla.org/en/using_files_from_web_applications#Using_hidden_file_input_elements_using_the_click%28%29_method
IE backs

Why can't you adopt doctypes from a clone of the current document view into the current document view? This code fails: var doc = document.cloneNode(true); /*remove all children from document...*/ document.adoptNode(doc.doctype)
document.adoptNode(doc.documentElement) works fine though
(you can try that in any non-webkit browser including IE9)
also, shouldn't using the document.styleSheets API trigger mutation events?
anybody know what a <require> tag might look like? a <script> that doesn't pollute the global namespace?

hsivonen: longdesc advocacy never had any traction. I'm not sure what you mean by the "calling text/html XHTML" thing, there was serious advocacy on both sides of that (including from me for years before whatwg!) so I don't think the same situation applies.
hsivonen: why it's an orgument, and has been an argument, is listed in the rest of the CCP

http://blogs.adobe.com/jd/2011/01/video-debate-cutting-to-the-chase.html would have more credibility (complaining about HTML design) if Adobe and j/d in particular actually ever sent real feedback on HTML
sephr: adoptNode() is going away
Hixie: then how will I adopt nodes?
it'll be automatic?
yeah
cool
already is in many browsers
well my problem is still present if I skip adoptnode
yeah the problem is probably more specific to DocType nodes
why can't you insert a doctype from another document into another document?
dunno
nobody knows :/
ms2ger might be able to tell you
yet it's consistant with EVERY browser
but he ain't here :-)
maybe you can't remove a doctype once it's in a doc?
try cloning the doctype itself
Hixie: I can /remove/ the doctype fine
and yeah I've clone the doctype itself
the problem has to do with separate views
I mean separate document views
and moving their doctypes to other document views
document views?
Documents
DocumentViews
same thing
oh and could you help with my second question?
should stylesheet.insertRule('x{}', stylesheet.cssRules.length); trigger a DOM mutation event?
assuming the stylesheet is in the document
Hixie
